page.title: 08PICKERING PARK: WEST HULL
page.content: The land for the park was the gift of Christopher Pickering. Mrs Pickering performed the opening ceremony in 1911,unlocking the wrought-iron gates with a gold key. The gates open onto an avenue lined with varieties of maple trees. In the grassy areas of the park there are mature horsechestnuts,willows, oaks and beeches together with small copses of silver birch and willow.The trees and shrubs have been chosen to give colour throughout the year. Formal rose beds contrast with the rock garden and its abundance of alpine and water plants. The lake is popular for fishing, feeding the geese and ducks and boating in summer. The aviaries house many tropical birds but it is the white peacocks which attract the most attention.
